metadata.title: CVE-2019-19067 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS 16.04 LTS (xenial) - low
metadata.description:
** DISPUTED ** Four memory leaks in the acp_hw_init() function indrivers/gpu/drm/amd/amdgpu/amdgpu_acp.c in the Linux kernel before 5.3.8allow attackers to cause a denial of service (memory consumption) bytriggering mfd_add_hotplug_devices() or pm_genpd_add_device() failures, akaCID-57be09c6e874. NOTE: third parties dispute the relevance of this becausethe attacker must already have privileges for module loading.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-19067` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-2-generic - 4.4.0-2.16
linux-image-4.4.0-2-generic-lpae - 4.4.0-2.16
linux-image-4.4.0-2-lowlatency - 4.4.0-2.16
linux-image-4.4.0-2-powerpc-e500mc - 4.4.0-2.16
linux-image-4.4.0-2-powerpc-smp - 4.4.0-2.16
linux-image-4.4.0-2-powerpc64-emb - 4.4.0-2.16
linux-image-4.4.0-2-powerpc64-smp - 4.4.0-2.16
linux-image-extra-4.4.0-2-generic - 4.4.0-2.16
No subscription required

linux-image-4.15.0-118-generic - 4.15.0-118.119~16.04.1
linux-image-4.15.0-118-generic-lpae - 4.15.0-118.119~16.04.1
linux-image-4.15.0-118-lowlatency - 4.15.0-118.119~16.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-118-generic - 4.15.0-118.119~16.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-118-lowlatency - 4.15.0-118.119~16.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1004-kvm - 4.4.0-1004.9
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1001-aws - 4.4.0-1001.10
linux-image-extra-4.4.0-1001-aws - 4.4.0-1001.10
No subscription required

linux-image-4.15.0-1083-aws - 4.15.0-1083.87~16.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1096-azure - 4.15.0-1096.106~16.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1084-gcp - 4.15.0-1084.95~16.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1054-oracle - 4.15.0-1054.58~16.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-4.2.0-1013-raspi2 - 4.2.0-1013.19
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1013-snapdragon - 4.4.0-1013.15
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1001-fips - 4.4.0-1001.1
linux-image-extra-4.4.0-1001-fips - 4.4.0-1001.1
linux-image-hmac-4.4.0-1001-fips - 4.4.0-1001.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: linux package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-2.16').
linux-hwe package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-118.119~16.04.1').
linux-oem: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
linux-kvm package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1004.9').
linux-aws package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1001.10').
linux-aws-hwe package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1083.87~16.04.1').
linux-azure package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1096.106~16.04.1').
linux-gcp package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1084.95~16.04.1').
linux-oracle package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1054.58~16.04.1').
linux-raspi2 package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.2.0-1013.19').
linux-snapdragon package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1013.15').
linux-fips package in fips/xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1001.1').
linux-gke: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
